alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; De Kalb; Fentress; Overton; Putnam; Van Buren; Warren; White (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 03 at 12:24PM CST until March 03 at 1:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Overton County in Middle Tennessee... Northwestern Cumberland County in Middle Tennessee... De Kalb County in Middle Tennessee... Northwestern Van Buren County in Middle Tennessee... Warren County in Middle Tennessee... White County in Middle Tennessee... Putnam County in Middle Tennessee... Western Fentress County in Middle Tennessee... * Until 100 PM CST. * At 1224 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Gordonsville to 6 miles southeast of Smithville to near McMinnville, moving northeast at 85 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Cookeville, McMinnville, Crossville, Sparta, Smithville, Jamestown, Spencer, Algood, Monterey, Baxter, Morrison, Allardt, Pleasant Hill, Doyle, Dowelltown, Liberty, Centertown, Hamptons Crossroads, Slate Springs and Virgin Falls State Natural Area. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 268 and 321. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CST for Middle Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CST for Middle Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Cumberland; De Kalb; Fentress; Overton; Putnam; Van Buren; Warren; White
